intro: Hieracium brachycodon, commonly known as the short-stalked hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20–50 cm, with basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, typical of the genus Hieracium. It thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and is often found in temperate climates.
